:

I wonder - it seems like you totally filled the trunk section of the spacecraft with tanks. That\'s not the case in real life - it\'s mostly empty, with just a few 'boxes' in there. There are no external fuel tanks visible or even in place, as far as I know. Only ECLSS connections, added batteries / possibly some gyro\'s, the solar panel assembly and the radiator assembly.

Its perfectly fine if you want to add them to your model, but if you want to be as correct as possible, it\'s basically just a place to pack a few boxes and attach solar panels...

Note:

http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/6/69/Manned_and_cargo_Dragon_spacecraft.jpg

http://www.collectspace.com/review/spacex_dragon12.jpg

http://www.eng.fea.ru/spaw2/uploads/images/Kvasova%20news/SpaceX%20Dragon2.jpg

no fuel tanks whatsoever in the trunk.

Model = Nice

Textures = GTFO
Keep in mind some parts aren\'t textured yet, the chrome blue / purple / pink parts only have a complete UV map, but no actual textures.

Model = Nice

Textures = GTFO

Those are UV maps, not finished textures.

I am quite aware. it is just a solar array and launches nano sats. However. In mine it will carry fuel. Sorry if they offends you.

I might offer an empty version. But i am in no way trying to copy anything exactly. if I like a trait I include it. if i dislike it. it is gone. but thanks

anyway. just have one more item to make model wise then i will get to texturing. oh joy...

Mr. CardBoardBox guy, you are my hero! I was looking for a way to model the SpaceX parts. Now we can have the KerbX Failcan series! Duct tape optional!

i know . many seem to be wanting spaceX stuff. me included. so I decided to make it. I am currently texturing. all models are complete (aside from adapters) but it should work for all 1.5 meter stuff.

also, i am cancelling production of the 3 meter size. i will be making something else 3 meter with the same function and relativity as the 1.5 meter version. The 3m variant was just too huge to be a Falcon.

textured all the RCS and crazy ball and cylinder tanks. and everything has some paint on it. tomorrow will add detail to the Capsule and such. will be a pain.

but i have to ask.

currently the Durgun the engines are powerful and use fuel rather quickly from the tank but landing you have the engine on 25% and it will keep you acceleration stable. ad use RCS to change it.

should I keep it that way or make them lower power and such so you have to run them on max the whole tiem form a certain high and it slows you down slowly until ground contact?

K. i did some test flights today and I think i am in love but anyway.

i am hoping to release someitmethis week. just have to finish texturing. So far i only have the RCS done. The rest should be rather simply in all honesty. just lines and dots.
Sweet, hope it\'s as fun to fly as you make it sound, you\'ve been doing great with this capsule.
8) it is nice. you can reenter and land with our the SaS on. i stays perfectly aligned with the retro burn with some very slight drag differences.
